headline: Three-Cheese Pesto Lasagna
description: Cheesy lasagna with pesto and greens! Great make-ahead meal for the fridge or freezer.
name: Three-Cheese Pesto Lasagna
keywords: Casserole, Comfort Food, Freezer-friendly, Make-ahead, American, Vegetarian, Dinner
recipeIngredient: 4 cups lightly packed basil leaves (about 4 ounces)
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (or slightly less this amount of table salt)
2 cup sliced crimini or brown mushroom caps (about 6 ounces)
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt (or slightly less this amount of table salt)
4 cups loosely packed kale leaves, chopped
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (or slightly less this amount of table salt)
2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil, divided
8 ounces mozzarella, sliced and torn into rough half moon pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Make the pesto: In the bowl of a food processor, pulse to combine the basil leaves, garlic, and pine nuts. Scrape down sides as needed. With the food processor running, and add the Parmesan, olive oil, lemon juice, and salt. Spoon into a bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap. Set aside. (This makes about 1 1/2 cups of pesto.)

Prepare the mushrooms: Set a large, deep-sided skillet over medium-low heat. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil, and then garlic, red pepper flakes, and pepper. Cook 1 minute, turn heat to medium, and add mushrooms and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Sauté mushrooms about 4 minutes, until they begin to release their water. Transfer to a bowl.

Prepare the greens: In the same pan used to cook the mushrooms, over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon olive oil. Stirring often, add the spinach and kale in 4 batches, salting each as it goes in the pan. Cook until greens have cooked down completely, about 5 minutes. Squeeze to remove excess water and set greens in a bowl.

Prepare the cheese sauce: In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and then cook, whisking constantly, 3 minutes. Next, gradually whisk in milk, adding a splash at a time, allowing mixture to thicken between additions; this should take 5 to 7 minutes. Once all milk has been added, cook mixture, stirring frequently, for another 5 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in 1 cup grated Parmesan.
Prepare the ricotta mixture: Lightly beat eggs. Fold in ricotta. Set aside.

Cook the lasagna noodles: Bring a large stockpot of water to a boil. Generously salt water and cook noodles until they are pliable but still have plenty of bite. Toss noodles with remaining teaspoon olive oil and set aside.
When ready to assemble and bake the lasagna: Preheat oven to 425°F. Grease a 9x13 baking pan with 1 teaspoon olive oil.

Assemble the lasagna: Arrange 4 cooked noodles lengthwise on the bottom of the baking dish. Spread half the ricotta mixture over noodles. Scatter half the greens over ricotta. Spoon 1 cup of cheese sauce over greens, scatter half the mushrooms, and dot with 1/2 cup pesto. Add another layer of noodles, and repeat layering. Add a final layer of noodles and top with the remaining 1/4 cup cheese sauce, dot with remaining 1/2 cup pesto, scatter mozzarella slices. Finish with a pinch each of salt and pepper.

Bake the lasagna: Set the lasagna on a tray to catch any drips and slide into hot oven. Cook 30 to 35 minutes, or until the filling is bubbling vigorously and the mozzarella is bubbly and golden brown in spots. Cool 15 minutes, slice, and serve. Reheating leftover lasagna : Cover with foil and reheat in a 350°F oven for 20 to 30 minutes or until piping hot. Freezing and reheating whole lasagna : Cook and cool the lasagna complete. Cover the dish with a piece of foil pressed against the surface and freeze for up to 3 months. To reheat, peel away the foil from the frozen lasagna and recover the pan (so the foil is no longer touching the lasagna but the pan is covered). Warm in a 350°F oven for 70 to 90 minutes until the cheese has melted and the center is piping hot. Uncover in the last 10 minutes if you'd like a browner crust. Freezing and reheating individual portions : Cook and cool the lasagna completely. Tightly wrap individual portions in aluminum foil, transfer to a sealable freezer bag or container, and freeze for up to 3 months. To reheat, unwrap the portions, transfer to an oven-safe dish, and cover with foil. Warm at 350°F for 30 to 35 minutes, until the cheese has melted and the center of each portion is hot.

review.reviewBody: This recipe deserves more ratings - it's a phenomenal twist on the classic, and has been requested many, many times in our household. Absolutely delicious!
I cooked this tonight and oh my goodness, was it heavenly! I added more greens and mushrooms than what was called for and it was just perfect. I will be making this one again!

This is a great recipe, though I add a layer of some hamburger and some Italian sausage in a red sauce. Also, I never cook my noodles!! If you add a little water to the sauces, its not neccesary to boil them 1st. I know that I just ruined a vegetarian recipe for some, but to my husband, its not a meal without some meat ( ;

Oh My Goodness Elizabeth, this is so Good, and my house still smells terrific! 
 
I made two batches of this to be used as a side dish for grilled fish, and will be sending it as a treat for my husband & friends fishing trip. The lasagna has been Flash frozen and vacuum packed for them to use with the Sous Vide method. 
 
I appreciate posters suggestions on how to prep the lasagna noodles ahead of layering. I laid them flat on an olive oil greased jelly roll pan and poured boiling water over them as suggested (so easy), and they turned out great. 
 
To make two batches I ended up buying three more basil plants at Home Depot in addition to the three I already had to make the pesto with. Hopefully the plants grow a lot more this summer so that I can make some more of this. Also used a disposable piping bag to apply the pesto. 
 
Thank you for sharing this recipe.
